title: Forget DeepSeek, Dying Alone Is China’s Latest Tech Obsession
description: This time last year, the hottest Chinese tech product was DeepSeek’s market-moving artificial intelligence model. In 2026, it’s something far simpler: an app for people worried about dying alone.
content:
This time last year, the hottest Chinese tech product was DeepSeek’s market-moving artificial intelligence model. In 2026, it’s something far simpler: an app for people worried about dying alone.

title: Case Study: How Competitive Intelligence Supported an AI Platform Company in Benchmarking Competitor Capabilities and Go-To-Market Strategy
description: Chicago, Jan. 22, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- As competition accelerates across artificial intelligence (AI) and generative AI platforms, technology companies are increasingly relying on Competitive Intelligence (CI) to support strategic decision-making. title: Firms must invest in real people to gain from AI, EY's Teigland says
description: Companies will not get productivity gains from artificial intelligence unless they invest in real people and redesign how work is done, Julie Teigland, EY's global vice chair, told Reuters on Thursday.
content:
DAVOS, Jan 22 (Reuters) - Companies will not get productivity gains from artificial intelligence unless they invest in real people and redesign how work is done, Julie Teigland, EY's global vice chair, told Reuters on Thursday.

title: Retailers fight return fraud with artificial intelligence
description: The average return rate last year was about 17%, according to industry data. Retailers say fraudsters are increasingly exploiting lenient policies, often by sending back cheaper or different items than what was originally purchased.
content:
Consumers returned nearly $900 billion worth of merchandise in 2024. While returns are considered a routine cost of doing business, return fraud is on the rise, leading retailers to turn to artificial intelligence to combat it.
